title: How to Update Your iOS on Your iPhone

steps.title: Back up and save your personal data to iCloud or iTunes.
steps.content: Back up and save your personal data to iCloud or iTunes. This will help prevent data loss in the event the update fails to complete. Tap on “Settings” > “iCloud” > “Backup,” then tap on “Back Up Now.” Alternately, follow these steps to back up your iPhone to iTunes .

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to a power source.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to a power source. This will prevent your device from powering down unexpectedly at any point during the update.

steps.title: Tap on “Software Update,” then tap on “Download and Install.
steps.content: Tap on “Software Update,” then tap on “Download and Install. ”

steps.title: Tap on “Install,” then enter the passcode for your iPhone, if applicable.
steps.content: Tap on “Install,” then enter the passcode for your iPhone, if applicable. Apple will download and install the latest updates to your device, which may take up to several minutes to complete. [1] X Research source If your iPhone displays an error saying it lacks enough free space to complete the update, either delete apps from your device manually to free up space, or follow the steps outlined in Method Two to update your iPhone using iTunes.

steps.title: Back up and save your personal data to iTunes or iCloud.
steps.content: Back up and save your personal data to iTunes or iCloud. This will help prevent data loss in the event the update fails to complete. Tap on “Settings” > “iCloud” > “Backup,” then tap on “Back Up Now.” If you want your data backed up using iTunes, continue with the following steps.

steps.title: Launch iTunes on your Windows or Mac computer.
steps.content: Launch iTunes on your Windows or Mac computer.

steps.title: Click on “Help” or “iTunes” at the top of your session and select “Check for Updates.
steps.content: Click on “Help” or “iTunes” at the top of your session and select “Check for Updates. ”

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to install any available iTunes updates.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to install any available iTunes updates. Your iPhone can only be updated using iTunes if iTunes is running the latest software.

steps.title: Connect the iPhone to your computer using a USB cable.
steps.content: Connect the iPhone to your computer using a USB cable. iTunes will take a few moments to detect your device.

steps.title: Click on your iPhone when it displays in iTunes, then click on the “Summary” tab.
steps.content: Click on your iPhone when it displays in iTunes, then click on the “Summary” tab. If you need to back up your iPhone to iTunes, click on “File,” point to “Devices,” and select “Back Up.” Proceed with the following steps when the backup process is complete.

steps.title: Click on “Check for update,” then click on “Download and Update.
steps.content: Click on “Check for update,” then click on “Download and Update. ” iTunes will install the latest iOS updates to your iPhone.

steps.title: Wait for iTunes to inform you the update is complete, then eject the iPhone from your computer.
steps.content: Wait for iTunes to inform you the update is complete, then eject the iPhone from your computer.

steps.title: Install any available OS updates from Microsoft Windows or Apple on your computer if you are unable to update your iPhone using iTunes.
steps.content: Install any available OS updates from Microsoft Windows or Apple on your computer if you are unable to update your iPhone using iTunes. In some cases, running older versions of software on your computer can prevent iTunes from communicating with Apple’s servers. Windows: Click on “Start” and select “Control Panel,” then click on “System” and select “Automatic Updates.” Mac OS X: Click on the Apple menu, and select “Software Update.”

steps.title: Try disabling or uninstalling any security software running on your computer if you are unable to update your iPhone using iTunes.
steps.content: Try disabling or uninstalling any security software running on your computer if you are unable to update your iPhone using iTunes. Some third-party software programs can interfere with your being able to install the latest iOS updates in iTunes.

steps.title: Remove any extra USB devices from your computer if you’re having problems installing iOS updates using iTunes.
steps.content: Remove any extra USB devices from your computer if you’re having problems installing iOS updates using iTunes. Printers, scanners, USB flash drives, and other USB-compatible devices may interfere with the installation of iOS updates. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Try restarting your iPhone or your computer if you experience problems installing iOS updates wirelessly or using iTunes.
steps.content: Try restarting your iPhone or your computer if you experience problems installing iOS updates wirelessly or using iTunes. In some cases, restarting your devices can help correct any bugs or problems interfering with the update process. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Try using another USB cable or USB port if iTunes is unable to recognize your iPhone.
steps.content: Try using another USB cable or USB port if iTunes is unable to recognize your iPhone. Problems with faulty hardware can prevent your computer from detecting your device and installing the latest iOS updates using iTunes.
